intro: Hiraea obscura, commonly known as the obscure hiraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features include a short, hairy stem and a clustered inflorescence. Hiraea obscura is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
